newsitem.title: FRANCE: Lyonnaise underperforms in falling market.
newsitem.headline: Lyonnaise underperforms in falling market.

text.p: Shares in Lyonnaise des Eaux fell sharply on Tuesday as the market marked down its expectations for the company from its merger talks with Cie de Suez.
Shares in the utilities group were down 4.00 percent at 552 francs ($98.11) per share at 1640 GMT, compared to a fall of 1.99 percent in Suez shares and of 3.15 percent in the CAC-40 blue chip index.

One analyst, who declined to be named, said the fall reflected the fact that the market was beginning to realise Lyonnaise did not have that much to gain from a merger with Suez, to be discussed at special board meetings of the two groups on April 11.
"It is reality setting in after the speculative bubble last week," he said.

Another cited worries about a demand earlier on Tuesday from glassmaker Saint-Gobain for a special payout equivalent to some 3.4 billion francs from Suez to its existing shareholders in return for their backing for the merger.

He said a comment by Saint-Gobain head Jean-Louis Beffa that it planned to sell a part of its six percent stake in Suez suggested he himself did not have much confidence in the merger as a way of maximising shareholder value.
